intro: Thouinia macroptera, commonly known as the large-leaf thouinia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
